messages.message:
Why is the table extraction removing the japanese characters and some symbols? And there is a column named (Unnamed:0)

For reference heres a screenshot of the OCR; it does appear

Hi Gwen,
For any columns that are not named - they are assigned an Unnamed column currently for internal representation. @Prashant Kikani do we clean these (Unnamed) columns before we respond to user queries?

For symbols being removed here - this is being for supporting better filtering / querying on top of tables, we have already recevied this feedback - and its planned of this Initiative for Q1 - https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1441
That makes sense @Rakesh can we open a separate ticket to cover non latin languages like chinese/japanese so it doesnt accidentally get removed?
To clarify this is what happened; it all got removed:
Another example where it only moved it from the second column

https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1496

This is currently a blocker for a mitsubishi
Is there a way to turn japanese detection on but turn table extractor off? The table results seem to be skewing my questions

Hi Gwen
The object detection mode currently both enables non-Latin languages as well as performs table detection. In future (Q1 intiiative) as build gets OCR configuration settings that would enable selecting only non-Latin language only.  If you are not using table extraction here - then this removal within detected table wont affect your regular queries as those still use OCR results.
What query are you using currently in Build to extract ? Also the LLM results for non-latin languages are not benchmarked as I understand and is not currently prioiritised.

@Rakesh @Prashant Kikani for this particular case, let's focus on understanding why certain Japanese characters got removed by TDF, and write down the root cause in the ticket. I'm less interested in the foreign language aspect but wonder if this is similar to the date formatting issue, that some of our custom smart rules when applying on data in the wild actually becomes too optimize for our own benchmarking dataset / less robust cc @Hari Let's understand this to give us a peace of mind, after we know the root cause we can decide whether to fix it or not.

@Gwen if you want to bypass table extractor, go to build and use the extraction mode instead of the reasoning mode. You can type in full sentence prompt there too.

Yes @Kerry itâ€™s the same as the formatting to the table case we see with date type as well. I am updating the ticket with details. Meanwhile checking with Gwen to unblock here as we work on the fix for formatting issue.
We worked on a prompt to unblock Gwen in the interim, Gwen will continue to use same template to try extracting other fields.
